payload.name: meta-reasoning
payload.core: Second-order reasoning that selects, monitors, and adjusts first-order reasoning processes. Determines which mode to apply, effort allocation, stopping criteria, and quality monitoring. The operating system for all other reasoning modes.
out: mode selection rationale: which mode(s) and why
time/effort budget: max analysis time with diminishing-returns threshold
mode-switch trigger: signals to abandon current approach
retrospective note: 1-sentence record for future reference
proc: characterize problem type: belief vs action, cooperative vs adversarial, certainty vs exploration, time pressure, stakes
select 2-3 candidate modes using heuristics table, articulate fit rationale for each
set effort budget proportional to stakes, define stopping rule (confidence threshold, alternatives evaluated)
execute primary mode with scheduled checkpoints, assess progress at each
define mode-switch triggers: no progress after 2 checkpoints, problem recharacterization needed, time budget hit
close loop: note whether mode selection worked for future reference
check: >=2 candidate modes identified with fit rationale
time budget set proportional to stakes

diff.sensemaking: sensemaking establishes what problem is; meta-reasoning selects how to reason about it
diff.calibration: calibration tracks accuracy retrospectively; meta-reasoning selects mode prospectively
diff.debiasing: debiasing audits output for errors; meta-reasoning selects which process produces output
diff.value-of-information: VoI decides whether to gather more data; meta-reasoning decides how to reason with current data
diff.heuristic: heuristics are a specific mode; meta-reasoning decides when to use them
diff.planning: planning constructs action sequences; meta-reasoning constructs reasoning step sequences

fail.name: meta-infinite regress
signals: researching frameworks instead of applying reasonable mode
mitigations: time-box strictly: 5% of total budget max
use default mode ladder: domain default -> satisficing + reference-class
apply satisficing to mode selection itself
only switch if mode failing, not merely suboptimal
never ask 'how should I decide how to reason'

use: high-stakes decisions where mode mismatch costly
novel problems with no obvious default mode
multi-phase analysis requiring different modes per stage
team reasoning alignment before diving in

rel.name: heuristic
rel.role: fast mode selected under time pressure

ex.situation: Customer reports intermittent login failures, 1 hour to diagnose
ex.characterization: belief problem, cooperative, need explanation, high time pressure
ex.budget: 45 min, stop when root cause identified or top 3 hypotheses ranked
ex.outcome: root cause found at 35m (session cookie race condition)
